metadata.title: CVE-2024-35874 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: aio:Fix null ptr deref in aio_complete() wakeup list_del_init_careful() needsto be the last access to the wait queue entry - it effectively unlocksaccess. Previously, finish_wait() would see the empty list head and skiptaking the lock, and then we'd return - but the completion path would stillattempt to do the wakeup after the task_struct pointer had beenoverwritten.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1003-laptop - 6.5.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-20.20').
linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').

linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1003.6').
